data.title: Great Restaurant
data.text: My friends and I went to this restaurant and I was amazed , we had no utensils, the food was put on Banana leaves along  the  middle of the table, everything I tried was so delicious, the sad part is I knew I had Chicken and Shrimp I have no idea what the other foods were, simply delicious.

data.title: Best Filipino All Around Food and Service
data.text: I have been going to this restaurant for over 6 years, ever chance I get when I am in San Diego.  It never disappoints.  I tried their boodie fight and it was fantastic.  The beef knuckle soups, the lechon kawaii and the fried banana turon are my favorite.

data.title: A Filipino Evening with Friends
data.text: The food was excellent - cooked perfectly - serving was generous - enjoyed the Kamayan - everything on it - grilled fish, crispy pork, grilled eggplant, red eggs, tomato, mango, bagoong ~ Filipino caviar, top quality rice etc etc and place was decently presented and clean and service was tops and reasonably priced.

data.title: Excellent Filipino Food
data.text: Friendly atmosphere, great tasting food, true representation of our great culinary.. Be sure to ask each dish that conquer your eyes to make sure that its the taste you are looking for.  Grilled items are all good and the Halo-Halo  is excellent.  Enough parking spaces for all diners closer to Hwy 5.  Lovely decors that came from The Philippines..  I wish that they will have souveniers that you can buy when you visit.

data.title: Good food
data.text: Was driving around driving solo and decided to stop at the Filipino Restaurant. Food was very good place was centrally located and restaurant was clean. Only thing I was disappointed in was at the food prices, a little over what I think would be fair.

data.title: Blah
data.text:
The food we ordered was so terrible! The food we ordered looked like someone in the kitchen just took a bunch of leftovers and put it together and heated it up. The presentation was worse...it was in served in bowls that had so many chips.  Not worth it for the price. 
Worse Filipino restaurant. People recommended that this restaurant was really good....
If you have bad taste.

data.title: Please do not waste$
data.text:
Pictures are always appealing.
Made reserevations 2weeks ahead.
Menu was the Barkada package-shrimp over cooked, calamari refried -who knows how many times  it was fried,,,,all breaded no calamari  to taste.
Side dish wash-beefsteak with awful smell of bad meat.
Only grilled eggplant was good.
Service not friendly,waitress rude.
Bathroom-do not go use-ugh!
Health Inspection or Food Safety Regulation -kindly dine and try food
Order Beefsteak or any meal with meat or beef,
Buy own banana leaf and lay out your own cook food or food from other
Filipino restaurants (conching,gemmaes,carlitos)

data.title: Love the food! Love the service!
data.text: I am recommending this restaurant to all of you. The atmosphere is family like setting. The price is reasonably affordable. The waitress is on time, always checked if we needed more help. Great for family birthday parties.

data.title: Fantastic new experience
data.text: We decided to try something new and found Villa Manila.  Never having had Filipino food before we were at a loss on what to order.  Our waitress was warm and welcoming and explained the items on the menu. There were so many choices I was still not sure what to order and asked if she would order for us, and she happily did.  Everything was delicious, especially the rice and noodles!

data.title: Very homey
data.text:
Villa Manila provides great homestyle Filipino food in a sit-down restaurant (homestyle assuming your mom is a great cook.)  I especially liked the vegetables (pinakbet and a dish that I can't even pronounce - guinataang sitaw & kalabasa).  I find that Filipino food is traditionally meat-oriented and often fried, so it was great to discover some tasty vegetables too!   

The restaurant is a short drive from downtown San Diego.  The food must be authentic, as far as I could tell, the rest of the diners were all Filipino families and we were the only non-Filipinos.  I noticed that most of their tables had soup tureens, so they must have great soups too.

data.title: Very good food and service
data.text:
We go to San Diego at least once a year, coming from Ventura County; this was our first time at Villa Manila, just a couple miles south of San Diego and fairly easy to reach from the Zoo and our hotel in Hotel Circle.
They had a special of 2 people for $20, and since it had 2-3 dishes that my wife and I both liked, it was an easy decision.  There's one dish for Starters, and an entree of a Noodle dish, and another entree. (Forgot if it was the Early Bird Special from 4-6 pm or not)
We had the Fried Calamari for starters (add $1), Pincit miki-bihon (egg & rice noodle), and the Crispy Pata (add $2), with a big bowl of white rice (which we didn't even eat, as the other 3 dishes were quite plentiful.  Calamari was excellent, not over fried.  The Pincit miki-bihon was also very good.  The Crispy Pata was good, but slightly dry in some pieces, but overly tolerable and still good.
We didn't have any dessert, since we were both stuffed to the gills.
Service with the one waitress was very excellent; she took the time to explain some things to us, and we did ask about other dishes, just in case we wanted to change our minds, since there was so many good things to order!
I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some genuine Filipino food in San Diego.

data.title: Good place to eat.
data.text: Food was good, atmosphere was basic. Service good.

data.title: Good food
data.text: This restaurant used to be the old Max's. Same cook. The crispy pata and sizzling sisig was delicious. The diniguan was too soupy for me. Overall, still great food and service. Will definitely make another trip before heading back home.

data.title: Для любителей острого мяса.
data.text: Очень понравились ребрышки, сомневаюсь что это Филиппинское блюдо, но приготовили его на 10 из 10. Закуски тоже были весьма аппетитные. Приятное место, хороший ценник.
